verses.verse: And it came <WG1096> about on one <WG1520> of the days <WG2250> while He was teaching <WG1321> the people <WG2992> in the temple <WG2413> and preaching <WG2097> the gospel, <WG2097> that the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the scribes <WG1122> with the elders <WG4245> confronted <WG2186> [Him,]

and they spoke, <WG3004> saying <WG3004> to Him, "Tell <WG3004> us by what <WG4169> authority <WG1849> You are doing <WG4160> these <WG3778> things, <WG3778> or <WG2228> who <WG5101> is the one who gave <WG1325> You this <WG3778> authority <WG1849>?"
And He answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to them, "I shall also <WG2532> ask <WG2065> you a question, <WG3056> and you tell <WG3004> Me:
"Was the baptism <WG908> of John <WG2491> from heaven <WG3772> or <WG2228> from men <WG444>?"

And they reasoned <WG4817> among <WG4314> themselves, <WG1438> saying, <WG3004> "If <WG1437> we say, <WG3004> 'From heaven, <WG3772>' He will say, <WG3004> 'Why <WG1223> <WG5101> did you not believe <WG4100> him? '

"But if <WG1437> we say, <WG3004> 'From men, <WG444>' all <WG537> the people <WG2992> will stone <WG2642> us to death, <WG2642> for they are convinced <WG3982> that John <WG2491> was a prophet. <WG4396>"
And they answered <WG611> that they did not know <WG3609> where <WG4159> [it came] from.
And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to them, "Neither <WG3761> will I tell <WG3004> you by what <WG4169> authority <WG1849> I do <WG4160> these <WG3778> things. <WG3778>"

And He began <WG757> to tell <WG3004> the people <WG2992> this <WG3778> parable: <WG3850> "A man <WG444> planted <WG5452> a vineyard <WG290> and rented <WG1554> it out to vine-growers, and went <WG589> on a journey <WG589> for a long <WG2425> time. <WG5550>

"And at the [harvest] time <WG2540> he sent <WG649> a slave <WG1401> to the vine-growers, in order <WG2443> that they might give <WG1325> him [some] of the produce <WG2590> of the vineyard; <WG290> but the vine-growers beat <WG1194> him and sent <WG1821> him away <WG1821> empty-handed.

"And he proceeded <WG4369> to send <WG3992> another <WG2087> slave; <WG1401> and they beat <WG1194> him also <WG2548> and treated <WG818> him shamefully, <WG818> and sent <WG1821> him away <WG1821> empty-handed.
"And he proceeded <WG4369> to send <WG3992> a third; <WG5154> and this <WG3778> one <WG3778> also <WG2532> they wounded <WG5135> and cast <WG1544> out.

"And the owner <WG2962> of the vineyard <WG290> said, <WG3004> 'What <WG5101> shall I do <WG4160>? I will send <WG3992> my beloved <WG27> son; <WG5207> perhaps <WG2481> they will respect <WG1788> him.'

"But when the vine-growers saw <WG3708> him, they reasoned <WG1260> with one <WG240> another, <WG240> saying, <WG3004> 'This <WG3778> is the heir; <WG2818> let us kill <WG615> him that the inheritance <WG2817> may be ours. <WG1473>'
"And they threw <WG1544> him out of the vineyard <WG290> and killed <WG615> him. What, <WG5101> therefore, <WG3767> will the owner <WG2962> of the vineyard <WG290> do <WG4160> to them?

"He will come <WG2064> and destroy <WG622> these <WG3778> vine-growers and will give <WG1325> the vineyard <WG290> to others. <WG243>" And when they heard <WG191> it, they said, <WG3004> "May it never <WG3361> be!"

But He looked <WG1689> at them and said, <WG3004> " What <WG5101> then <WG3767> is this <WG3778> that is written, <WG1125> 'The stone <WG3037> which <WG3739> the builders <WG3618> rejected, <WG593> This <WG3778> became <WG1096> the chief <WG2776> corner <WG1137> [stone]'?

"Everyone <WG3956> who falls <WG4098> on that stone <WG3037> will be broken <WG4917> to pieces; <WG4917> but on whomever <WG3739> <WG302> it falls, <WG4098> it will scatter <WG3039> him like <WG3039> dust. <WG3039>"

And the scribes <WG1122> and the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> tried <WG2212> to lay <WG1911> hands <WG5495> on Him that very <WG846> hour, <WG5610> and they feared <WG5399> the people; <WG2992> for they understood <WG1097> that He spoke <WG3004> this <WG3778> parable <WG3850> against <WG4314> them.

And they watched <WG3906> Him, and sent <WG649> spies <WG1455> who pretended <WG5271> to be righteous, <WG1342> in order <WG2443> that they might catch <WG1949> Him in some statement, <WG3056> so <WG5620> as to deliver <WG3860> Him up to the rule <WG746> and the authority <WG1849> of the governor. <WG2232>

And they questioned <WG1905> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Teacher, <WG1320> we know <WG3609> that You speak <WG3004> and teach <WG1321> correctly, <WG3723> and You are not partial <WG2983> <WG4383> to any, but teach <WG1321> the way <WG3598> of God <WG2316> in truth. <WG225>
"Is it lawful <WG1832> for us to pay <WG1325> taxes <WG5411> to Caesar, <WG2541> or <WG2228> not?"
But He detected <WG2657> their trickery <WG3834> and said <WG3004> to them,
" Show <WG1166> Me a denarius. <WG1220> Whose <WG5101> likeness <WG1504> and inscription <WG1923> does it have <WG2192>?" And they said, <WG3004> "Caesar's."
And He said <WG3004> to them, "Then <WG5106> render <WG591> to Caesar <WG2541> the things that are Caesar's, and to God <WG2316> the things that are God's."

And they were unable <WG3756> <WG2480> to catch <WG1949> Him in a saying <WG4487> in the presence <WG1727> of the people; <WG2992> and marveling <WG2296> at His answer, <WG612> they became <WG4601> silent. <WG4601>
Now <WG1161> there came <WG4334> to Him some <WG5100> of the Sadducees <WG4523> (who say <WG483> that there is no <WG3361> resurrection <WG386>),

and they questioned <WG1905> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Teacher, <WG1320> Moses <WG3475> wrote <WG1125> for us that if <WG1437> a man's brother <WG80> dies, <WG599> having <WG2192> a wife, <WG1135> and he is childless, <WG815> his brother <WG80> should take <WG2983> the wife <WG1135> and raise <WG1817> up offspring <WG4690> to his brother. <WG80>
"Now <WG3767> there were seven <WG2033> brothers; <WG80> and the first <WG4413> took <WG2983> a wife, <WG1135> and died <WG599> childless; <WG815>
and the second <WG1208>
and the third <WG5154> took <WG2983> her; and in the same <WG5615> way <WG5615> all <WG3588> seven <WG2033> died, <WG599> leaving <WG2641> no <WG3756> children. <WG5043>
"Finally <WG5306> the woman <WG1135> died <WG599> also. <WG2532>
"In the resurrection <WG386> therefore, <WG3767> which <WG5101> one's wife <WG1135> will she be? For all <WG3588> seven <WG2033> had <WG2192> her as wife. <WG1135>"
And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to them, "The sons <WG5207> of this <WG3778> age <WG165> marry <WG1060> and are given <WG1061> in marriage, <WG1061>

but those <WG3588> who are considered <WG2661> worthy <WG2661> to attain <WG5177> to that age <WG165> and the resurrection <WG386> from the dead, <WG3498> neither <WG3777> marry, <WG1060> nor <WG3777> are given <WG7031> in marriage; <WG7031>

for neither <WG3761> can <WG1410> they die <WG599> anymore, <WG2089> for they are like <WG2465> angels, <WG2465> and are sons <WG5207> of God, <WG2316> being <WG1510> sons <WG5207> of the resurrection. <WG386>

"But that the dead <WG3498> are raised, <WG1453> even <WG2532> Moses <WG3475> showed, <WG3377> in the [passage about the burning] bush, <WG942> where <WG5613> he calls <WG3004> the Lord <WG2962> the God <WG2316> of Abraham, <WG11> and the God <WG2316> of Isaac, <WG2464> and the God <WG2316> of Jacob. <WG2384>
"Now <WG1161> He is not the God <WG2316> of the dead, <WG3498> but of the living; <WG2198> for all <WG3956> live <WG2198> to Him."
And some <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122> answered <WG611> and said, <WG3004> "Teacher, <WG1320> You have spoken <WG3004> well. <WG2573>"
For they did not have <WG5111> courage <WG5111> to question <WG1905> Him any <WG3765> longer <WG3765> about anything. <WG3762>
And He said <WG3004> to them, "How <WG4459> [is it that] they say <WG3004> the Christ <WG5547> is David's son <WG5207>?
"For David <WG7035> himself <WG846> says <WG3004> in the book <WG976> of Psalms, <WG5568> 'The Lord <WG2962> said <WG3004> to my Lord, <WG2962> "Sit <WG2521> at My right <WG1188> hand, <WG1188>
Until <WG2193> I make <WG5087> Thine <WG4771> enemies <WG2190> a footstool <WG5286> for Thy feet. <WG4228>"'
"David <WG7035> therefore <WG3767> calls <WG2564> Him 'Lord, <WG2962>' and how <WG4459> is He his son <WG5207>?"
And while all <WG3956> the people <WG2992> were listening, <WG191> He said <WG3004> to the disciples, <WG3101>

"Beware <WG4337> of the scribes, <WG1122> who like <WG2309> to walk <WG4043> around <WG4043> in long <WG4749> robes, <WG4749> and love <WG5368> respectful greetings <WG783> in the market <WG58> places, <WG58> and chief <WG4410> seats <WG4410> in the synagogues, <WG4864> and places <WG4411> of honor <WG4411> at banquets, <WG1173>

who <WG3739> devour <WG2719> widows' houses, <WG3614> and for appearance's sake <WG4392> offer <WG4336> long <WG3117> prayers; <WG4336> these <WG3778> will receive <WG2983> greater <WG4053> condemnation. <WG2917> "
